original_text: We sat down next to each other, but David wouldn't look at me. He lowered his head what he was thinking. I had high hopes for him so I wanted to let him join the cross-country. I comforted him in a soothing voice, "you have work so hard for this event. I hope your work hard is rewarding, I will support you forever." My words like a warm stream rushed his being. David raised his eyes meet my eyes with his eyes sparkling with confident. David felt inspired. I was pleased beyond description that I can light his strong determination. David was thinking for a while, "I hope I can try it." He laughed, his eyes shining with excitement. I pulled him into my arms, "I believe you can do it." I watched as David moved up to the starting line with the other runners. But David still had butterflies in his stomach and his hands were sweaty. With starting competition. So nervous was him that he was slow.

overall_evaluation.brief_comment: 作文基本切题，情节连贯，语言表达有一定情感色彩，但存在较多语法错误和用词不当，影响了整体表达的准确性和流畅性。

如‘David still had butterflies in his stomach and his hands were sweaty’体现了角色紧张的心理状态。

language.evidence: ‘My words like a warm stream rushed his being’运用了比喻手法，增强了语言感染力。
使用了‘soothing voice’, ‘beyond description’, ‘shining with excitement’等表达，提升了语言丰富度。

detailed_errors.original_sentence: He lowered his head what he was thinking.
detailed_errors.correction: He lowered his head, lost in thought.
detailed_errors.explanation: 原句缺少连接词，导致句子结构断裂。‘what he was thinking’不能直接跟在动词后，需用逗号分隔或改写为独立主格结构。
detailed_errors.advanced_suggestion: He bowed his head, deep in contemplation.

detailed_errors.original_sentence: I had high hopes for him so I wanted to let him join the cross-country.
detailed_errors.correction: I had high hopes for him, so I wanted to encourage him to join the cross-country team.
detailed_errors.explanation: ‘cross-country’是名词短语，应加‘team’；‘let him join’不够正式，可用‘encourage him to join’提升表达质量。
detailed_errors.advanced_suggestion: I had great expectations for him and hoped to inspire him to take part in the cross-country race.

detailed_errors.original_sentence: you have work so hard for this event.
detailed_errors.correction: you have worked so hard for this event.
detailed_errors.explanation: 现在完成时需要过去分词形式，‘work’应改为‘worked’。
detailed_errors.advanced_suggestion: you've put in so much effort for this race.

detailed_errors.original_sentence: I hope your work hard is rewarding
detailed_errors.correction: I hope all your hard work pays off.
detailed_errors.explanation: ‘work hard’是动词短语，不能作主语；应使用名词性表达‘hard work’，并搭配‘pays off’这一固定搭配。
detailed_errors.advanced_suggestion: I truly believe your dedication will be rewarded.

detailed_errors.original_sentence: My words like a warm stream rushed his being.
detailed_errors.correction: My words, like a warm stream, flowed into his heart.
detailed_errors.explanation: ‘rushed his being’不符合英语习惯表达，应改为更自然的比喻句式。
detailed_errors.advanced_suggestion: My words, like a gentle stream, touched his soul deeply.

detailed_errors.original_sentence: David raised his eyes meet my eyes with his eyes sparkling with confident.
detailed_errors.correction: David raised his eyes to meet mine, his eyes sparkling with confidence.
detailed_errors.explanation: ‘meet my eyes’应为‘to meet mine’；‘confident’是形容词，此处需名词‘confidence’。
detailed_errors.advanced_suggestion: David lifted his gaze to meet mine, his eyes gleaming with unwavering confidence.

detailed_errors.original_sentence: I was pleased beyond description that I can light his strong determination.
detailed_errors.correction: I was pleased beyond description that I could ignite his strong determination.
detailed_errors.explanation: 情态动词‘can’应根据上下文使用过去时‘could’；‘light’在此处不如‘ignite’贴切。
detailed_errors.advanced_suggestion: I was overjoyed to see that I had sparked his inner strength.

detailed_errors.original_sentence: But David still had butterflies in his stomach and his hands were sweaty. With starting competition.
detailed_errors.correction: But David still had butterflies in his stomach and his hands were sweaty as the race began.
detailed_errors.explanation: ‘With starting competition’语法错误，应使用时间状语从句‘as the race began’。
detailed_errors.advanced_suggestion: Yet his nerves remained palpable—butterflies fluttered in his stomach, and his palms grew clammy as the starting gun echoed through the forest.

detailed_errors.original_sentence: So nervous was him that he was slow.
detailed_errors.correction: So nervous was he that he started slowly.
detailed_errors.explanation: 倒装句中主语应为‘he’而非‘him’；‘was slow’不准确，应描述行为‘started slowly’。
detailed_errors.advanced_suggestion: So overwhelmed by anxiety was he that he hesitated at the starting line, barely moving forward.

revised_text: We sat down next to each other, but David wouldn't look at me. He lowered his head, lost in thought. I had high hopes for him, so I wanted to encourage him to join the cross-country team. I comforted him in a soothing voice, 'You've worked so hard for this event. I hope all your efforts pay off. I'll always be here to support you.' My words, like a warm stream, flowed into his heart. David raised his eyes to meet mine, his eyes sparkling with confidence. He felt inspired. I was overjoyed to see that I had sparked his inner strength. After a moment of silence, he said, 'I hope I can try it.' He smiled, his eyes shining with excitement. I pulled him into my arms. 'I believe you can do it,' I whispered. As David moved up to the starting line with the other runners, his nerves remained palpable—butterflies fluttered in his stomach, and his palms grew clammy. So overwhelmed by anxiety was he that he hesitated at the starting line, barely moving forward. Yet, with every step, he found courage within himself, ready to face the challenge ahead.
